title: Manchester United face potential injury blow ahead of Liverpool visit after David de Gea suffers muscle injury
text:
Manchester United have been given a huge scare ahead of Sunday’s clash against Liverpool at Old Trafford after goalkeeper David de Gea suffered a muscle injury on international duty with Spain on Tuesday night.

Just as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer hoped United’s dreadful injury problems were easing ahead of the visit of the Premier League leaders, the manager has been dealt a potential setback with De Gea now a doubt for the game.

De Gea was clearing a back pass when he pulled up with an apparent hamstring injury an hour into Spain’s 1-1 Euro 2020 qualifying draw with Sweden in Stockholm and immediately dropped to the ground in pain.

The 28-year-old – who was replaced by Chelsea’s Kepa Arrizabalaga – was able to walk off the pitch in the company of Spain’s physios but the prospect of him missing Liverpool would be an acute blow for Solskjaer with pressure mounting on the United manager.

Solskjaer was preparing to welcome back the cavalry, with Anthony Martial, Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Luke Shaw and Victor Lindelof – who lined up against De Gea for Sweden – all in contention to return for the visit of Jurgen Klopp’s in-form side as United bid to arrest their alarming slide.
description: Manchester United have been given a huge scare ahead of Sunday’s clash against Liverpool at Old Trafford after goalkeeper David de Gea suffered a muscle injury on international duty with Spain on Tuesday night.
